initial.title: Step 0: Initial State
initial.description:
FCFS (First Come First Served) is a non-preemptive scheduling algorithm.

Core Rules:
- Processes execute in the order they arrive
- Once a process starts, it runs to completion
- Tie-breaker: Process ID (alphabetical order)

Our problem set has {num_processes} processes: {process_list} with different arrival times.

show_arrivals.title: Step 1: Sort by Arrival Time
show_arrivals.description:
First, sort all processes by arrival time. If arrivals are equal, use Process ID.

Sorted order: {sorted_order}

RS (Ready State) markers show when each process enters the ready queue.
This is always the first step - mark the arrival times on the timeline.

first_process_first_block.title: Step {step}: Process {process_id} begins execution
first_process_first_block.description:
Process {process_id} arrives first at t={arrival} and has burst time of {burst}.

Since FCFS is non-preemptive, {process_id} will run to completion.
We start by coloring in the first block at t={current_time}.

Blocks to fill: {burst} total

process_start.title: Step {step}: Process {process_id} begins execution
process_start.description:
Process {process_id} arrived at t={arrival}{wait_context}.

{prev_process} finished at t={prev_end}, so {process_id} starts now at t={current_time}.
{process_id} has burst time of {burst}, so we begin coloring in its blocks.

{wait_info}

continue_block.title: Step {step}: Process {process_id} continues (t={current_time})

process_complete_block.title: Step {step}: Process {process_id} completes (t={current_time})
process_complete_block.description:
Process {process_id} completes its final block!

Started at t={start_time}, completed at t={end_time}.
Total execution: {burst} time units.
Waiting time: {wait_time} (started at {start_time} - arrived at {arrival})
